comments.body: Maybe (just maybe) skeleton skulls could be found rarely in the deep dark (the skeletons who disturbed the warden, and other hapless explorers)
I'd love to see combination of caves and coral reefs. Imagine finding them underground!
This is a great idea, as you could be able to prevent mob spawns without slabbing the floor, or using other methods that are less attractive.

of course, I have more ideas for this like instead of using block detection you could use 1-8 bottles of honey and coat the spider woodblock to receive an entangled spider woodblock (all names are just suggestions of course)

If anything, these mobs In particular would supposed to give The player a sense of Anxiety, knowing that everything that Isn't a sculk sensor or a block could get them killed, be It the floor below, the ceiling, chests, and even sometimes hiding behind walls. The Idea Is that sculk Itself Isn't a problem, but the stuff made from It can be terrifying, especially when it comes to the warden. these mobs are to act as ways for the warden to catch you when All hope (In their warden's case) Is lost, With watchers watching and scourges scourging.... and wardens.... warding? (I guess.)

as a sidenote, Ideas I had for Drops would Include the "Sculk Eye", which could be used with XP to make ores glow, even through walls, and maybe Sculk Scales from the Scourge, which can be thrown to leech a mob's life force In return for giving you XP, something many players would consider useful.
new deep dark mobs are cool, like a Sculk Monster that is like a weaker warden, or Sculk Crickets that are blind mobs that live amongst the sculk, and look for players to eat
i don't think the deep dark is this kind of biome, by the devs showed it looked to me like a lifeless biome, with an invencible enemy
Or don't go to the deep dark.
Deep dark will most likely be a rare biome I assure you. An if you see one get out. Its simple.
But I might go hunting for the deep dark for skulk sensors. Lol
Fr, that mob sucks, the noises it makes are horrifying and it doesn't have the charm the enderman does.
Just feels more like a mod. feels out of place.
yes this is so needed like for miss shift clicks great idea
But if you lose the durability it will not work with you

Yes, but such a powerful item must be protected, maybe [if it ok with you] my 'frost cubes' idea could be protecting the table...but we must get this and it votes...VOTE FOR DISMANTLE TABLE AND FROST CUBE...

I've made an idea similar, although it was rejected because they thought it was a Cat Scratching Tower which probably means they don't read anything, in mine I called it a Scratching Table but it had the same function.

You are very ingenious, your idea Is very cool!
From Marcello198 for EnderFre.
During a full moon, they could naturally spawn enemy Skeleton Wolves, but archeology would be a way of getting one as a pet.
Maybe some time of structure in a cave to locate it, would be cool.
They talked about this on Spawn Chunks. Great idea and very appropriate.
Que allá un nuevo ataque del warden. Una explosión enorme que no rompa ningún bloque y que dañe sólo a los mobs. Que te aviente lejos y que te de un nuevo efecto que se llame wardinent.
I just thought about this too! Such an easy idea to implement that would open so many doors
Well, crouching already hides the sound, so you could just crouch before you hit the ground

Of course the player can already crouch, but if you think in other mobs, it is very useful to silence their vibrations in some cases. Also give the slow falling potion another use, giving the phantom a very unique propose for redstone contraptions. ^^
Crouching is not a very good system for navigating the deep dark, since it is really slow. A potion of slow falling would make it way better.

Tuff could be a really great block only if it had a diffrent color. Currently Tuff is nothing else than slightly diffrent dead coral when in Minecraft there are many gray blocks, but yet we don't have ANY block in the game that has the color between sandstone and stone.

So if ther are not going to change that i don't think that it makes sense to make it generate like this
I hope that tuff is easily renewable, it's a great building block for roads, and players will need a lot of it.
why
I think it might be to complex for some people, but i also think it could be decently educational!
too hard to say
Is this a joke suggestion?
Plz devs rename it to this i love geology

The dripstone should be split into 2 different blocks and have 2 different names depending on whether it is on the ceiling or floor. If it is on ceiling it should be callled stalactite and if it’s on floor it should be called stalagmite.
The Goat Horn could naturally repel mobs like the Ravager yell. There could be a Ravager Horn that does the same except it is just as powerful as the yell
Goat Horns could also have an enchantment that does this
I'm pretty sure potions don't usually do the same thing as enchantments, and there is already an enchantment for this.
Zombeive234 the effects could stack. but i think that cranzag's idea is better, something to repel nearby monsters.
YESSSS. My god brilliant idea, this would be so useful for combat and map making
I do not see much logic although if the mobs should be afraid of the warden
великая идея
Well, piglins fear soul itens, so they should avoid sculk, specially the shrieker and the catalyst.
Maybe make hostile mobs spawn in more frequently than normal

Spawning more mobs would only make it a better location for mob farming.
Maybe have it's presence have certain crops grow faster or exclusively.
If it could detect a humidity variable, like in swamps vs deserts, that could be interesting too.
Thank you
Agreed. I posted the EXACT same thing. The sprite looks amazing but the model also is great

Yes!! Just had this happen to me. I ended up having to go afk over night and when I woke up not all of my cauldrons were even full (8 hours of afk with normal settings). It takes way too long to get just one bucket. Please change this!

Edit: To clarify, I was playing on the java version of MC

I strongly agree with this, I'm a bedrock player and have been attempting to get a powdered snow bucket with normal settings. Sitting afk for this long is so impractical and should be replaced to 10 - 20 mins.
yee unacceptable had me afk for so long and nothing clearly snowing too
I have an idea for the achievement name (freeing the prison) you can achieve this achievement by killing a small group of wardens .
The warden is something mojang wants players to run from not go to so it will not work like that. Maybe an achievment for seeing the warden.
Maybe you get some xp like with the “How Did We Get Here” and “Return to Sender” advancments.

I think if you kill the Warden and all the other monsters in the game, you should get a special achievement, kind of like a sequel to the Monster Hunter achievement and it gives you 100 experience. The icon for this achievement would be a diamond sword.
i think the achievement should be "Noo! William!" or somethin
I would prefer much more a unique method of renewability instead of just mob drops, and probably for a item such as Cobwebs Mojang would prefer that too

RunOut64 I agree, and disagree. You never said an alternative in your comment to my post on why it should be a different source of renewability. So I still think mob drops is better.  Maybe cobwebs could be crafted with string? Which can be found, and obtained by killing mobs, and in loot chests.

I agree, cobwebs are great for decoration as well as traps, but unfortunately they're very limited and not renewable. I'd say that cave spiders should drop cobwebs instead of string, making them more unique. Or, perhaps there should be a way to craft cobweb with string.
I've been wanting renewable cobwebs for so long, it's useful for many things. If cave spiders drop cobweb, it'll give a reason for players to revisit Mineshafts!
I think it should be cave spiders that drop cobweb, thus making it still necessary to venture down into mineshafts to get the material whilst making it renewable.
I agree that Cave spiders must be the source to make it renewable but instead of dropping it, it would be way cooler and challenging if they can summon cobwebs around the player
I love this, you might just want iron and copper, with gold near the base of the mountain.
Esta idea me parece increible
I like this idea. However, I believe that diamonds should stay where they are now as diamonds would become too easy to find. Other than that, good job.
Nice idea, could also be a nice decoration
Great Idea!!!
While Dripleaves fall when walked on, these ladders could actually pop up, knocking the player off

A cool idea but I think it would be hard to implement. Maybe it would be better instead of being hard coded to the biome to have a block that emits the gas and works when in radius of that block? Though maybe that would be op and sort of replace tnt.

Maybe a hostile mob, too. Going along the lines of blindness and deep cave creatures, a crayfish that spawns in deep water pools, with a low y-level. It would add more life to caves, and a new challenge.
Are they blind?
we definitely need more food options underground. Maybe also more mushrooms to make stew.
